statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} 7 \\ 1 \\ -1 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -1 \\ 4 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 0 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ 1 \\ -2 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -1 \\ -8 \\ -15 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} 7 \\ 1 \\ -1 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -1 \\ 4 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 0 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ 1 \\ -2 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -1 \\ -8 \\ -15 \end{array}\right].
